alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 15 at 5:02PM CDT until April 15 at 5:15PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DOUGLAS COUNTY... At 501 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 17 miles northeast of Gainesville, or 20 miles southwest of Willow Springs, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Bryant Creek State Park. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
